I've decided I have social anxiety disorder...I was thinking about how screwed up some of things I do are, and some of the things I say are and it social anxiety disorder sounds almost exactly like what I've got. For example? I've been talking to this awesome girl over the Internet for the past month or so...2 weeks ago she gives me her number and I call her, we talk for about an hour and then I never call again...why? because I got so worried that if I called I'd say the wrong thing or she'd think I was pestering her or whatever, so much so that she wouldn't want to meet me. Thinking about, I knew it was ridiculous and that she was probably waiting for me to call back, but I just couldn't bring myself to do it. So now, I've pissed her off and freaked her out (since I tried to explain why I hadn't called), so...yeah, I fucked it. Just nerves you say? How about this? My buddies' wedding in July, I'm talking to a guy who used to be my best friend in elementary school who I hadn't talked to in a long time...he tells me he's going up to a cottage the next weekend with a few guys and would really like it if I'd go...I was a bit nervous but I said sure and said I'd call to work out the details...did I call? Of course not! Why you ask? BECAUSE I AM A FUCKING MORON! And it goes on from there...why did I fuck up in university? Because I was so god damned nervous about everything and introverted that I couldn't admit to anyone that I needed help! Why did I have no friends all through high school? Because when I changed schools and didn't know anyone anymore, I couldn't make any new friends because I couldn't get the nerve up to actually talk to anyone! Why am I 24 and never even been on a date? Other than the fact that I'm a fat slob that is? Because I have absolutely no self-esteem, and apparently have no balls....so now that my self-diagnosis is complete, what am I going to do about this? In all likely hood nothing. Christ, I haven't even been to the doctor, not even for a checkup or anything, since my first year of highschool, which was 10 years ago! And you think I'm going to go to a shrink? Not bloody likely. No, I'll probably just wallow in my self-doubt for the rest of my life...probably end up drinking myself to death, who knows?

Back from Vegas...got home around 1am this morning, been sleeping most of the day. It was a very good trip, other than the whole me losing $180 part. Though I'm not actually that pissed about losing, I figured I'd gamble around $200, its just the way I lost. I would be up $20 or $30, but instead of walking away then and there, I would keep pressing, until I got down, which would then mean I had to keep playing to try and at least get back to even, which eventually led to me having nothing...ahh well. Some other thoughts: - stayed at the Monte Carlo ( urlLink website ). Pretty nice hotel, reasonably cheap ($69 a night Mon-Thurs, $89 Sun since it was 4th of July). Nothing spectacular about it though - it was very very very hot...think the highest it got was 107 degrees. Even the wind is hot. Although its true what they say, its a dry heat. There's no humidity there and it makes it bearable. If it was that same temperature here, with our humidity, I might die. - Vegas isn't as cheap as people think (maybe it is if you go off strip to some of the lower end hotel/casinos, but we didn't) - the Coyote Ugly bar at the New York, New York seems to be nothing but a tourist trap. Pay $10 cover, to get into a tiny little room with one big bar with a platform for drunk tourists to dance on and another smaller bar and thats it...maybe because it was a Monday night, but it still sucked - every few feet on the strip there are these guys who hand out these cards for escort services which are basically porn with little stars over the naughty bits. Its ridiculous how many there are. Apparently they're called Slappers because they slap the cards in their hand a few times as you approach and then try and jam them in your way. - I can very easliy see how people can get addicted to gambling. You get such a rush of adrenaline and confidence when you win that you feel invincible. And when you ineveitbly lose, you still have that confidence that a few more hands or spins of the roulette wheel and you can be back on top. Next time I go, I'm bringing an envelope for each day, and thats my limit for that day. Otherwise, you can end up dropping $100 in less than an hour (not that I did, though I was tempted too just lay down a $50 on red or black a few times) - maybe it was because I was always playing $5 or $10 tables, but drink service was really slow at every casino. Sure, I'm not a high roller, but if I'm losing money at your hotel, you should at least give me something for it. And its not like I don't tip well, I was giving $1 a bottle hoping that would speed things up, never did though. - we couldn't find anywhere to watch the Euro 2004 final. When we got to the hotel the game should have been around halfway through the 2nd half...so we rushed to the hotel's pub, they aren't showing it. We figure, lets go to the ESPNZone restaurant next door at the New York, New York, they've got to be showing it, they have a billion tv's showing everything. Nope, apparently it was only being shown on a pay-per-view basis in the US...if we wanted to watch it, they gave us the names of 2 bars that might, but by the time we got there, the game would've been over anyways. Then, it took us forever to find out what the score even was. It took about 45 minutes of watching ESPN's ticker until they finally got to the score, and even then, all it said was Greece 1-Portugal 0. Never mind who scored, when they scored, if it went into extra time, nothing. Ridiculous. - one of the older, dirtier hotels on the strip had a bar that featured mud wrestling Monday nights. Of course we had to go. It was great, plus the fact that you could get all you could drink draft for $15 (only Bud Light or Miller Light though, but after your 12th cup, it doesn't make much difference). Apparently the way it worked was they got 4 girls from a strip club (Cheetah's, more on that place later)...they wrestle, and then the winner out of those 4 faces challengers from the audience. There wasn't any nudity or anything, just the occasional nip-slip, but it was fun nonetheless. urlLink Click here for some pictures - the Mandalay Bay has a big shark reef exhibit that was well worth the $15 admission. Apparently they have the only Hammerhead Shark in captivity in the US, along with a bunc of other cool exhibits like crocodiles, piranhas, jellyfish, sting-rays. The Mandalay Bay in general is a pretty cool place...lots of eye candy there, and the pool looked like a pretty cool scene (not that I'm one for pools, but I do enjoy the scenery). Only problem is its at the tail end of the strip and its a long walk to get to anywhere - didn't go see any shows since they were so damned expensive. $80 for Cirque du Soleil, which is cool (I saw it a few years ago, got the tickets for my birthday), but not worth it IMO. The magic show in our hotel, Lance Burton, was $66 for balcony seats, plus who knows if there's a 2 drink minimum or whatever. My friend really wanted to go see on of these topless reviews for some reason. I kept telling him though that why would we pay $37.50 to go sit miles away from the stage and watch some showgirls dance to cheesy showtunes when we could go the the strip club for roughly the same and see it up close and personal? I think my friend was a little disappointed that we didn't go to any shows, he felt like we needed to 'do something', but I was happy drinking my beers, seeing the sights and just enjoying the atmosphere Now, on to my inevetible strip club thougts: - never, ever, ever, ever take a cab driver's advice for what strip club to go to...they get paid by the clubs for every fare they bring there, and everyone we asked said the Spearmint Rhino...I objected but my friend took the bait so we went there first. Plus, there weren't really all that many girls. Better than Spearmint Rhino, but definitely not what I remembered - Tuesday night, we decide to head to Cheetah's. I think I might be the only person on the face of this planet that didn't really like Spiderman 2. How can he give up being Spiderman? Even if he didn't actively go out and fight crime, shouldn't he still have his powers like spider sense and his strength? And they really dragged out how he was tormented and wrestling with his identity. How, in virtually every scene with Doc Ock, can you hear him coming from a mile away, but when he gets the tritium from Harry he can sneak away? Or when Doc Ock throws the car at Peter and Mary Jane, why doesn't anyone hear him coming, but luckily Peter's spidey-sense saves them at the last second? Did he throw the car from 5 miles away? Also with that car throwing scene...Doc Ock is supposed to be finding Peter to find out who Spiderman is (they don't know yet), so wouldn't it be a safe assumption that nailing him with a car might kill him? Could Peter have taken his mask off any more? So much for his secret identity - now a whole subway car full of people know, Mary Jane knows, Harry Osborn knows. Also, how fucking cheesy was it to have Mary Ann running from the altar to be with Peter at the end. Overall I was disappointed. Especially after every review said it was the best comic book movie ever and all that crap. I'd take the first Batman any day.

My mom and sister want me to go on this South Beach diet with them (they haven't started yet, but figure that it would be hard for them to be on it and not me). Supposedly my aunt lost 15 lbs in 3 weeks and my uncle lost 10. I'm pretty hesitant about it though. From what I understand of it, for the first two weeks you basically cut out everything except very select meats, vegetables, cheese and some other crap. Thats when the major weight loss happens. After the two weeks, you start adding carbs, which I guess turns it into practically the same as the Atkins diet, all carbs. From then on, if you maintain you should lose 1-2 lbs a week. First of all, from what I gather, most of the weight loss during the first 2 weeks is mostly water loss. From then on, its a whole lot of carbs and not much else, which doesn't seem healthy. Plus, if at any point you stop seeing results, apparently you're supposed to repeat the first two week crash diet. Seems sketchy to me. Of course, when I voice my objections, they figure its just because I don't want to curb my beer drinking, not that I could possibly think it is unhealthy. Plus, while there's no question that I could stand to get in shape and drop some pounds, for whatever reason I'm not all that motivated to do anything about it. Maybe its because I'm lazy, or maybe I'm set in my routines or maybe its because I've accepted that I am the way I am. As they say, "Its better to burn out than to fade away".
